pages.text: Corumbella comes from the Upper-most Edicaran, with fossils found in the Mato Grosso Do Sul, Brazil, and White Mountains, California (USA). They are small tubular forms, growing up to 3 cm in height. The segments of their shells were made up of right-angled plates, which formed thick thick polygonal rings, hailing the advent of skeletogenesis, and the beginning of the arms race between predator and prey.
